value.title: Ryanair Accused Of 'Invasive' Facial Recognition Use
value.excerpt: A prominent digital privacy campaign group on Thursday filed a complaint against Ryanair in Spain, alleging the popular budget carrier was pushing customers to undergo an "invasive facial recognition process".

value.title: Privacy group challenges Ryanair's use of facial recognition
value.excerpt: Digital rights group NOYB on Thursday filed a complaint against Ryanair , alleging that it is violating customers' rights to data protection by using facial recognition to verify their identity when booking through online travel agents.

value.title: A Painting Newly Attributed to Raphael by A.I. Facial Recognition Goes on View for the First Time
value.excerpt: A painting of the Madonna and child is on view in the U.K. city of Bradford after A.I. determined it was the work of Raphael.

value.title: Should police use facial-recognition technology? Ann Arbor to vote on issue
value.excerpt: ANN ARBOR, MI — Ann Arbor is once again considering restricting police use of a facial-recognition technology and city officials are planning to vote on the issue soon. City Council Member Linh Song, D-2nd Ward, advised her council colleagues July 17 to expect a resolution to come forward possibly in the next two months.

value.title: ESRB Proposes Using Facial Recognition To Verify Your Age
value.excerpt: The Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) has asked the FTC for approval to use facial recognition technology to help determine how old a user is. Using something called Privacy-Protective Facial Estimation, a person's age would be estimated based on a photo to verify they are old enough to purchase a game.

value.title: The movement to limit face recognition tech might finally get a win

value.title: Cedar Rapids airport testing facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: The Eastern Iowa Airport in Cedar Rapids is one of 25 airports in the U.S. that are testing new facial recognition technology in TSA lines. The new technology adds to the previous authentication methods by taking a picture of the traveler to match against their ID.
